page.title: 01HOME LIFE
page.content: We interviewed twelve people from Frettenham and Spixworth all of which had colour televisions. Six had dogs, four had cats,three had birds, two had fish and one person had a rodent. (some people had more than one pet) Nine people belonged to clubs. The average household had four people. Most families had one car. More people had lived in their present house for more than ten years. Unusually for this area coal was used in six of the houses for heating. (six=coal,three=electricity,three=gas) Most families had two bicycles. Only three people had computers. Five people had video recorders. Everybody had a newspaper/magazine delivered to their door.
